xwikidoc.author: XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 27 June 2013
xwikidoc.content: <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant 08:21 <mcupak> has joined #medsavant 08:37 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 08:41 <bvancea> hey sdumitriu 08:41 <bvancea> what's up? 09:45 <sdumitriu> Hey bvancea 09:47 <bvancea> I'll finish up refactoring the varaint service and tests class 09:47 <bvancea> and then continue to play around with the hardcoded querries 09:47 <bvancea> we're still having that hangout today, right? 09:48 <sdumitriu> Yes 10:00 <mcupak> has joined #medsavant 11:19 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 12:47 <bvancea> hmm, I can't seen to run medsavant from an ide 12:47 <bvancea> due to the version 12:47 <bvancea> I've been running it from the jar for quite a while :| 12:48 <bvancea> how do you guys run it? 12:53 <mcupak> has joined #medsavant 13:04 <sdumitriu1> bvancea: From the command line... 13:04 <sdumitriu1> I fixed it for NetBeans 13:04 <bvancea> I've been running from the command-line too 13:05 <bvancea> I just tried to debug from the ide and didn't manage to do so 13:06 <bvancea> I'll try to find a fix for idea as well :) 13:07 <mcupak_> has joined #medsavant 13:34 <mcupak> has joined #medsavant 14:02 <mcupak> hi bvancea, are we having that hangout today? 14:02 <bvancea> um 14:02 <bvancea> yes 14:02 <mcupak> what time? 14:03 <bvancea> we should have started 14:03 <bvancea> 8 minutes ago 14:03 <bvancea> sdumitriu 14:03 <bvancea> when should we be starting? 14:03 <mcupak> thought so, just checking my info is up to date :) 14:03 <bvancea> hehe 14:04 <sdumitriu1> Just a minute 14:04 <sdumitriu1> Setting up 14:04 <bvancea> ah, ok 14:04 <mcupak> thanks! 14:12 <jimv_> has joined #medsavant 14:13 <sdumitriu1> https://plus.google.com/hangouts/_/a2dffb712ed3d8503292eafa6d5ec71718cfcbe6?hl=en 14:54 <bvancea> https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-yQ95oZ8xURH5zzgPTJKWn0dxg88UO4BuyK8MscLScI/edit?usp=sharing 14:55 <bvancea> I should probably send an email to development@medsavant with this 14:56 <bvancea> can anyone confirm you can access it? 15:22 <bvancea> sdumitriu, how exactly did you think about the JPQL abstraction layer? 15:24 <bvancea> I'm thinking about something like this: List<Entity> results = persistence.query("SELECT e FROM Entity e WHERE e.field = ...") 16:12 <Jim_> has joined #medsavant 16:34 <sdumitriu1> bvancea: Yes, we can access it 16:35 <sdumitriu1> bvancea: Here's XWiki's query module: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-query 16:35 <sdumitriu1> It's more complex than what we need 16:35 <sdumitriu1> I like the Query interface from there 16:36 <sdumitriu1> The workflow is: QueryManager makes a Query object 16:36 <sdumitriu1> You can add settings to that Query: order, offset and count, query filters, etc 16:36 <sdumitriu1> Once you're done customizing the query, you execute() it 16:37 <bvancea> I see 16:37 <bvancea> nice 16:37 <bvancea> Query should be typed, right? 16:37 <sdumitriu1> Yes 16:37 <sdumitriu1> The complex part in XWiki that we don't need is that it supports multiple query languages 16:38 <sdumitriu1> What we want is similar to XWQL 16:38 <sdumitriu1> Which is an XWiki-specific extension of JPQL 16:39 <bvancea> wow, it's a pretty complex module 16:39 <bvancea> with its own query language 16:39 <bvancea> really nice 16:39 <bvancea> thanks for the tips and the link 16:39 <bvancea> :D 16:39 <sdumitriu1> It uses sablecc to parse the query 16:42 <bvancea> hmmm 16:43 <bvancea> and you can specify some rules for parsing in a different file, right? 16:46 <bvancea> sablecc looks a lot like lex/yacc 16:46 <sdumitriu1> Yes, it's a compiler compiler 16:47 <bvancea> hehe 16:47 <bvancea> nice 16:47 <sdumitriu1> (cc) 16:47 <bvancea> yup, I like the ya in yacc 16:48 <bvancea> I should have totally paid more attention to the translators course 17:21 <bvancea> I'll be off to bed, good night 17:21 <sdumitriu1> Good night
